summary.p: A mathematical function that returns the absolute (positive) value of the specified numeric expression.

syntax.code: ABS(value AS decimal) RETURNS decimal ABS(value AS double) RETURNS double ABS(value AS short) RETURNS short ABS(value AS int) RETURNS int ABS(value AS long) RETURNS long ABS(value AS sbyte) RETURNS sbyte ABS(value AS float) RETURNS float

param.name: value
param.p: Is a numeric expression for which the absolute value should be determined.

returns.p: A number, x, such that 0 ≤ x ≤ MaxValue.

examples.p: The following example shows the results of using the ABS function on three different numbers.
examples.sampleCode: SELECT ABS(-1.0) AS [ABS(-1.0)], ABS(0.0) AS [ABS(0.0)], ABS(1.0) AS [ABS(1.0)]
